title.rendered: George Brown College Course Registration Portal 2024 | Register Now

content.rendered:
George Brown College course Registration portal is designed to allow students to perform Registration, course Registration, pay tuition fees, update their address, and other student-related options. Applyjobs portal makes it easier for students to log in to the student portal at ease.

Contents on This Page

Toggle

  • George Brown College Courses
  • George Brown College Courses and Fees
  • George Brown College Courses and Fees for International Students

To enroll for Courses online in George Brown College student portal, kindly follow the link Course Registration All newly admitted students and Current students are to ensure that courses are registered before the deadline.

About George Brown College Course Registration Portal

George Brown College Course Registration Portal is a student web interface to the University’s student information system that allows students to enroll in courses, check fees and finances, update their address and emergency contact information, and more.

George Brown College Courses

George Brown College offers a wide range of courses in various fields of study, including business, technology, health sciences, design, hospitality, and culinary arts. Here are some examples of courses offered at George Brown College:
  1. Introduction to Accounting
  2. Introduction to Computer Programming
  3. Anatomy and Physiology for Health Sciences
  4. Introduction to Marketing
  5. Web Design and Development
  6. Fundamentals of Hospitality and Tourism
  7. Culinary Techniques
  8. Graphic Design and Layout
  9. Introduction to Early Childhood Education
  10. Introduction to Mechanical Engineering

George Brown College Courses and Fees

The tuition fees for George Brown College courses may vary depending on the program and level of study. Here are some estimated tuition fees for the 2022-2024 academic year:

Undergraduate Programs:

  • Business: $5,500 – $8,000 per year
  • Technology: $5,500 – $8,000 per year
  • Health Sciences: $5,500 – $8,000 per year
  • Design: $5,500 – $8,000 per year
  • Hospitality and Culinary Arts: $6,500 – $10,000 per year

Graduate Programs:

  • Graduate Certificates: $5,500 – $8,000 per year

Note that these are estimated fees and may be subject to change. It’s recommended to visit George Brown College’s website for the most up-to-date information on tuition fees for individual programs.

George Brown College Courses and Fees for International Students

The tuition fees for international students at George Brown College may vary depending on the program and level of study. Here are some estimated tuition fees for the 2022-2024 academic year:

Undergraduate Programs:

  • Business: $15,596 – $23,600 per year
  • Technology: $15,596 – $23,600 per year
  • Health Sciences: $15,596 – $23,600 per year
  • Design: $15,596 – $23,600 per year
  • Hospitality and Culinary Arts: $17,506 – $26,550 per year

Graduate Programs:

  • Graduate Certificates: $15,596 – $23,600 per year

Note that these are estimated fees and may be subject to change. It’s recommended to visit George Brown College’s website for the most up-to-date information on tuition fees for international students for individual programs.

George Brown College Course Requirements

The course requirements for George Brown College may vary depending on the program and level of study. Generally, admission to a program at George Brown College requires meeting the following criteria:

  1. Meeting the minimum academic requirements: This may include a certain grade point average (GPA) or specific prerequisite courses depending on the program.
  2. Submitting a complete application: This includes providing transcripts, English language proficiency test scores (if applicable), and any other required documents.
  3. Meeting any additional program-specific requirements: Some programs may require applicants to submit essays, portfolios, or attend an interview or audition.
  4. Meeting the English language proficiency requirements: International students whose first language is not English may be required to provide proof of English language proficiency through a standardized test such as TOEFL, IELTS or equivalent.

How to Access the George Brown College Login

If you are a student or staff member of George Brown College, you can access various online resources and services by logging in to your account. Here are the steps to log in to your George Brown College account:

  1. Go to the George Brown College website at www.georgebrown.ca.
  2. Click on the “Log In” button located in the top right corner of the website.
  3. Enter your username and password in the respective fields.
  4. Click on the “Log In” button to access your account.

How to Access Courses on George Brown College Course Portal

To enroll in courses on George Brown College Student Portal,

  • Visit the student Login Portal
  • Enter your Student Number (Email) and Password
  • Click the sign in button
  • Click Enroll course

For further details on the course Registration process, please chat with your college counselor.

George Brown College Course Registration

To register for courses at George Brown College, you need to follow these steps:
  1. Visit the George Brown College website.
  2. Click on the “Current Students” tab and select “Registration and Records.”
  3. Log in to your account using your student ID and password.
  4. Browse available courses and select the ones you want to take.
  5. Check for course prerequisites and make sure you meet them before registering.
  6. Add the selected courses to your schedule and select the preferred section.
  7. Confirm your schedule and pay any applicable tuition fees.
  8. Check your email for a confirmation of your course registration.

How to Drop Courses on your Dashboard

To drop courses directly from your dashboard,

  • Visit the student login page
  • Enter your Student ID and Password
  • Click the Add/Drop Course button
  • Fill the form as given
  • Submit

Note:

For making updates to the choice of program, courses, and so on, students must adhere to deadlines for dropping and adding courses and to ensure that your program of study is complete and up-to-date.
